name: Villas of Grand Cypress

reviews.text: The Villas are a great deal for the Orlando area, especially if you need alot of space. The property is lovely and quiet since this is first and foremost a golf resort. The units are very spacious and nicely furnished. The carpet and bedspreads had seen better days, however, and our tiny kitchen was in desperate need of renovation. Our refrigerator needed to be fixed twice during our stay and the enormous microwave looked like it was manufactured in the 70's. I was told that many villas have been recently remodeled so be sure to ask for a newer unit. That may explain the differences in opinions as to whether the Villas are a bit "grungy" or fantastic.
reviews.title: Good Deal In Orlando
Grand, Except for the Maintenance
reviews.text: Families need to be aware that the Villas cater primarily to golfers. If you want two double beds in your rooms, make sure you book straight with the hotel and get a guarantee in writing. We didn't and ended up using an air mattress in one room. I wasn't thrilled with the reception staff (allergic to children) but everyone else was great. The shuttle came promptly when we wanted to use the "fun" pool over at the Hyatt.

We had a family reunion at the Villas of grand Cypress and really had a fantastic time. With ages from 77 to less than a year we needed a place that catered to all tastes and needs. The grounds are absolutely georgous and meticulously maintaned, unfortunately we couldn't say the same for the rooms (we had 4 total villas). The toilets ran constantly, the sink stoppers didn't work, the toaster arced and sparked and the general cleanliness was far less than you'd expect for a resort of this caliber. That being said the rooms are large with plenty of room both inside and outside. Our location on the water with views of the golf course was very relaxing and conducive to our nightly cocktail party. The fireplace was great and used each night due to the cool temps with wood supplied generously by the resort. The pool is secluded and quiet with most of the action a shuttle ride away at the main Hyatt resort. The kids gravitated toward the Hyatt side of the resort and loved the game room and the free 9 hole Pitch n' Putt. Shuttles were fast and courteous.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.disliked: — Front desk check in and out.

reviews.text: My husband & I and our 2 kids (6&9) stayed at the Villas of Grand Cypress during our Disney Vacation. I would highly recommend this resort to EVERYONE! The 2 bedroom villa that we stayed in was immaculate! I couldn't have asked for more space. In addition to the 2 master bedrooms, there were also 2 full master bathrooms both with a separate shower and Jacuzzi tub. We stayed at the villas for an entire week, and dreaded going home. I must say the kitchens were a little outdated, but the remainder of the villa took up for it. Also, the washer and dryer came in very handy. We did not bring any dirty clothes home besides what we wore home. The maid service is outstanding. My kids looked forward to the chocolates that were left on our pillows every night! Whenever we return to Florida, my husband and I both agree we will most definitely be staying here again.
reviews.title: The best kept secret in Orlando
Cannot wait to go back.
reviews.text: For anyone that wants a luxurious oasis of calm at the heart of the Orlando tourist belt, this is the perfect place. Not quite as swanky as the Ritz Carlton, it's still a very upmarket resort with twice daily maid service, full room service, etc. On top of this, each villa has the advantage of a kitchen (great for making something simple when you've had enough of eating out) with washer/dryer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed over Labor Day weekend 2006. After spending a week at Marriott's Cypress Harbour with sister in-law's family and doing "the Disney Thing" for 6 straight days, my husband and I (with six year old son) were ready to "wind down" and relax a bit.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So when they (sister in law, her husband and two boys) headed back home, we checked into Grand Cypress. We were in a one bedroom villa, directly on the golf course, and next to the villa pool. My husband played golf for three days - I believe they have 5 or 6 courses on site. Guests of the Villas have access to the all the facilities of the Hyatt Grand Cypress right down the road. This is where you will find the absolutley immense pool with underwater caves, a suspension bridge and several water slides. They have a "kids camp" program that runs all day. This is where our six year old spent his time. I absolutely loved the villa pool, and preferred to be there, right next to our villa. The pool is very large, beautifully landscaped, and peacefully quiet.
reviews.title: Wow!

likes.liked: — Views across to Disney World and fireworks

reviews.text: There is a bar right next to the pool, and you can order food from the clubhouse restaurant right there. It will be delivered to you poolside, with linens and silverware. The quality of the food is outstanding, The service is impeccable. I really can't find enough good things to say about this resort. There are many other recreational activities in addition to the outstanding golf courses. They have bicycles for rent next to the pool area. They also have an outstanding equestrian center with a large tack shop and covered riding arena. If you're not an accomplished horseman, there is also a western trail ride available over at the Hyatt Grand Cypress.
reviews.title: Incredible stay at the Villas of Grand Cypress

reviews.text: The villa itself was spacious, with a beautiful patio area overlooking one of the golf courses. A wonderful living room, wet bar, full dining room, kitchen, bedroom, and large bath with a
reviews.title: overpriced, outdated, grungy

likes.liked: — wide open pastoral setting yet close to Disney World.

reviews.text: Just returned from 2 nights in Orlando with my 8yo daughter. Stayed here with a pal and his 2 girls in a 2br/2ba - Perfect layout for 2 families - 2 master bedrooms on opposite ends of the unit (ours had very comfortable kings in each bedroom plus a fold out queen couch)- tons of space and privacy - great bathrooms and great housekeeping kept us stocked with plenty of pillows and towels for all!
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: very clean - very upscale - very comfortable - very quiet - great water and golf views from every room - several very large outside patios for relaxing - getting sun - eating room service (which was delivered incredibly fast!) - feeding the ducks - watching the golfers and even DW fireworks at night (much rather see them from here than packed like a sardine on DW Main Street). Full sized and well-stocked kitchen/refrig/ microwave/ coffee maker/washer dryer. our unit even had very large and separate living and dining rooms.
reviews.title: Did not want to leave!

reviews.text: Grounds were beautiful - Easy check-in (although a little snotty at the golf club) - complete with complimentary cocktails - which is always a big plus (even more so when in Orlando). Great pool and hot tubs, not to mention two jacuzzis right in our room (one in each bathroom) which kept the kids busy for hours while us dads vegged out and watched a (one of 3) large screen plasma which was hung over a wood-burning fireplace which was conveniently located right next to the wet bar.
reviews.title: Best kept secret in Orlando

reviews.text: minutes from all disney parks and tons of restaurants but it might as well have been a world away - never fear - peace and quiet and a beautiful relaxing oasis does exist for those traveling to Orlando, and this place is it! I'm just sorry I didn't know about it sooner, since I've previously paid much more elsewhere, and didn't get 1/2 as much - or 1/3 as nice as this place. Highly recommended!!
reviews.title: Quite simply, fabulous!

reviews.text: It was a magical stay...My husband and I travel with our 6 year old twin girls to visit Disney World we stayed in a one bedroom villa...Just to start I was not looking foward to having to go DW and standing in long lines and in the heat...but I know it was something we had to do...so I wanted to make sure the place we stay was something special to go back to...After doing alot of research and comparing properties with the dw ones Yacht Club, Polyenissian,Grand Floridan and the Beach Club none of them could offer what the Grand Cypress could your own private villa with full kitchens,patios, Spacious sleeping areas and living areas. the maid service was great they come twice a day once in the morning to clean and again at night to turn your beds down and close your blinds. check in was a breeze pull right up they open your door you walk in and the clerk already has all of your information and to top off they offer you something to drink.
reviews.title: Great stay / Parfait séjour golfique

aka: The Villas Of Grand Cypress Hotel Orlando
description: With its appealing atmosphere of seclusion and easy proximity to entertainment attractions across central Florida, the Villas of Grand Cypress is the go-to destination for business and leisure travelers in Orlando. Located adjacent to Walt Disney World yet seemingly a world away, the 1,500-acre resort features 146 luxury villas, world-class amenities, ample meeting space, and engaging activities including 45 holes of Jack Nicklaus Signature-designed golf, the renowned Grand Cypress Academy of Golf, and complimentary bicycles.
